answers.answer: That vl sounds a little too high to be accurate.  Maybe get your hands on a copy of the results.  I was 53, newly type 2 diagnosed when I started tx.  Treatment and type 2 are ok together, should not be a reason to not treat - if that's your decision. HCV, type 2 and treatment have a lot of interplay.  In fact, your hcv could be a contributing factor to blood sugar 'abnormalities'.  See an experienced hepatologist and check in with an endocrinologist and maybe even get them on the same page.  You can successfully treat hcv and deal with type 2.  It's a balancing act and may require some lifestyle changes.  It's doable and beats the alternative.
